revised_title: On the Extraction and Distribution of Thallium in Ores
tldr: The author investigates the extraction and distribution of thallium in various ores, discovering that it is widely distributed but not uniformly present in mineral veins. Thallium is found in iron pyrites containing copper, as well as in native sulfur, zinc, cadmium, bismuth, mercury, and antimony ores. The author also presents a process for extracting thallium from its ores.
